He is the founder and director of SensiLab.Research interestsComputational Creativity Human-machine interfaces Tangible interfaces Cybernetic systems Agent-based modelling Visualisation and virtual environments Electronic Media Art Evolutionary Music and Art Artificial Life Computer Music Generative SystemsSupervision interestsComputational Creativity Human-machine interfaces Tangible interfaces Cybernetic systems Agent-based modelling Visualisation and virtual environments Electronic Media Art Evolutionary Music and Art Artificial Life Computer Music Generative Systems Monash teaching commitmentResearch only staff member Education/Academic qualificationComputer Science, Doctor of Philosophy, Monash UniversityAward Date: 15 Oct 2004Computer Science / Applied Mathematics, Bachelor of Science Honours, Monash UniversityAward Date: 1 Nov 1987Film and Animation, Graduate Diploma of Art (Film and Television), Swinburne University of TechnologyAward Date: 1 Nov 1986Computer Science / Applied Mathematics, Bachelor of Science, Monash UniversityAward Date: 1 Oct 1985 Research area keywordsARTS/HUMANITIES/CULTURAL ACTIVITIESArt Works/ArtifactsArtificial Intelligence/CyberneticsArtificial LifeElectronic Media ArtEvolutionary ComputingComputer MusicComputer GraphicsCreativityDevelopmental ModelsDigital Computers/ComputingDigital DesignDigital MusicDigital imaging and photomediaEcosystemsElectronic MediaEvolutionary computingGenerative ArtL-SystemsMorphogenesisSound ArtsVirtual RealityVisual ArtsVisualizationInteraction DesignAugmented RealityMusic Composition Collaborations and top research areas from the last five years Recent external collaboration on country/territory level.
